info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 19 at 9:49PM EDT until March 23 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro.
* WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 21.0 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 02/22/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING
